Name: Including menstrual cups in the definition of feminine hygiene products and the provision of such products.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including menstrual cups in the definition of feminine hygiene products and the provision of such products
BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 25, 2023

Summary: This bill would define the term feminine hygiene products to include menstrual cups, tampons, and pads for purposes of applying such term in local law. It would also require the Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS) to include menstrual cups in the provision of feminine hygiene products to agencies, for further distribution to persons in temporary shelters, and youth in secure detention or congregate care facilities. Additionally, this bill would require the Department of Correction to provide all female incarcerated individuals with menstrual cups as soon as practicable upon request.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      
      Section 1. Section 1-112 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision 23 to read as follows:
      23. "Feminine hygiene products." Menstrual cups, tampons, and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      � 2. Chapter 1 of title 1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 1-115 to read as follows:
      � 1-115 Feminine hygiene products. Any law, rule, order, or other document, or material created by the city which uses the term "feminine hygiene product" or "menstrual hygiene product" shall be deemed to include menstrual cups, tampons, pads, or any other products in relation to the menstrual cycle in the use of such term.
      � 3. Section 9-141 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by chapter 322 of the laws of 2021, is amended to read as follows:
      � 9-141 Feminine hygiene products. a. Definitions. As used in this section, the following terms have the following meanings:
      Feminine hygiene products. The term "feminine hygiene products" means menstrual cups, tampons, and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      Menstrual cup. The term "menstrual cup" means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      b. Distribution of feminine hygiene products. All female incarcerated individuals in the custody of the department shall be provided, at the department's expense, with feminine hygiene products as soon as practicable upon request. All female individuals arrested and detained in the custody of the department for at least 48 hours shall be provided, at the department's expense, with feminine hygiene products as soon as practicable upon request. [For purposes of this section, "feminine hygiene products" means tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.] 
      � 4. The definition of "feminine hygiene products" set forth in subdivision a of section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:
      Feminine hygiene products. The term "feminine hygiene products" means menstrual cups, tampons, and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      � 5. Subdivision a of section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended by adding a new definition of "menstrual cup" in alphabetical order to read as follows:
      Menstrual cup. The term "menstrual cup" means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      � 6. This local law takes effect immediately.

\ul 23. \ldblquote Feminine \cf0 hygiene products.\cf1\rdblquote  Menstrual cups, tampons, and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\ulnone\par
\'a7 2. \cf0 Chapter 1 of title 1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 1-115 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 1-115 Feminine hygiene products. Any law, rule, order, or other document, or material created by the city which uses the term \ldblquote feminine hygiene product\rdblquote  or \ldblquote menstrual hygiene product\rdblquote  shall be deemed to include menstrual cups, tampons, pads, or any other products in relation to the menstrual cycle in the use of such term.\par
\cf1\ulnone\'a7 3. Section 9-141 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by chapter 322 of the laws of 2021, is amended to read as follows:\par
\'a7 9-141 Feminine hygiene products. \ul a. Definitions. As used in this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Feminine hygiene products. The term \ldblquote feminine hygiene products\rdblquote  means menstrual cups, tampons, and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\par
Menstrual cup. The term \ldblquote menstrual cup\rdblquote  means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\par
b. Distribution of feminine hygiene products.\ulnone  All female incarcerated individuals in the custody of the department shall be provided, at the department\rquote s expense, with feminine hygiene products as soon as practicable upon request. All female individuals arrested and detained in the custody of the department for at least 48 hours shall be provided, at the department\rquote s expense, with feminine hygiene products as soon as practicable upon request. [For purposes of this section, \ldblquote feminine hygiene products\rdblquote  means \cf0 tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.]\cf1  \par
\'a7 4. The definition of \ldblquote feminine hygiene products\rdblquote  set forth in subdivision a of section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:\par
Feminine hygiene products. The term \ldblquote feminine hygiene products\rdblquote  means \ul menstrual cups,\ulnone  tampons\ul ,\ulnone  and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\par
\'a7 5. Subdivision a of section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended by adding a new definition of \ldblquote menstrual cup\rdblquote  in alphabetical order to read as follows:\par
\ul Menstrual cup. The term \ldblquote menstrual cup\rdblquote  means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\par
\ulnone\'a7 6. This local law takes effect immediately.\ul\par
